comments.body: This feels too detailed for external users, do we really want to document how exactly we select RCs, whether we do head-based development or not, …?

I don't really say "how" we do it, just that we do it. I think it's nice to give some indication of what happens behind the curtain and this seems harmless to me, but I don't feel strongly about it. Maybe @cmblitz has some thoughts on this, too.
My first reaction was to agree with @cocreature that was too detailed.  But I think you should check with other developers to see whether they appreciate this info or just find it extraneous.
Maybe just move the process to the very end. versioning, cadence, release notes and roadmap seem clearly useful. The process less so, so it shouldn’t hide the useful things.
